About Me

I'm Arslan Ali working mainly in C++ & Linux. I design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable C/C++ codes. I am well acquainted with code review, refactoring, testing, maintaining, and writing excellent documentation. I also have a strong passion for AI & Machine Learning.

Previously, I’ve worked as a Graduate Research at Korea University of Technology & Education, South Korea, with interests lies in Machine Learning & Teleoperation. I worked with C++ and Python development with Linux, Robot Operating System (ROS), and high-performance physics engines for simulations i.e. gazebo. I also had worked with Unity, OpenGL, and Windows Desktop Application development using C++ & MFC.

Selected Projects

Decision Tree Classifier
Novel Learning From Demonstration Approach For Repetitive Teleoperation

In Collaboration with Human Assistive Robotics Group at TUM, Germany, funded by German Research Foundation and MOTIE South Korea

  • C/C++, Python, Linux, ROS, physics engines i.e. bullet/ODE

    • This research work was supported by German Research Foundation (DFG) and the Industrial Strategic Technology Development Program (10069072) funded by the MOTIE, South Korea.We addressed the issue of reducing cognitive workload of human operator for repetitive teleoperation tasks. Learning from demonstrations can reduce the human operator's burden by learning repetitive teleoperation tasks. However, one of challenging issues is that demonstrations via teleoperation are less consistent compared to other modalities of human demonstrations. The proposed Expectation Maximization (EM) algorithm were able synchronize and encode demonstrations with temporal and spatial variances, different initial and final conditions and partial executions.The proposed algorithm had been tested and validated with three different experiments of a peg-in-hole task conducted on 3-degrees of freedom master-slave teleoperation system. This work had been published in 2017 IEEE World Haptics Conference Munich, Germany and ranked top 10%.

    Human subjective study for teleoperation of soft continuum growing robot in a virtual environment

    In Collaboration CHARM Lab Standford University, USA, funded by US department of Defence and Republic of Korea’s Ministry of Trade, Industry, and Energy (MOTIE)

  • C#, Unity, OpenGL, Chai3d

    • This research work had been done in collaboration CHARM Lab Standford University, USA and supported by US department of Defence and Republic of Korea’s Ministry of Trade, Industry, and Energy (MOTIE) research program on robots for humanitarian assistance.Teleoperation of continuum soft robot is an daunting tasks especially in an clutter environments.We initially studied and evaluate different commercially available device for the teleoperation of vine robot (soft continuum growing robot) in an simulated clutter environment developed in unity 3d game engine.The proposed intuitive flexible interface have shown better performance compared to available device such as phantom premium, joystick or game pad. The developed simulation framework had been presented as a talk session on soft robotics at 2017 IEEE World Haptics Conference Munich, Germany.

    Ferro Fluid Based Finger Tactile Device

    Funded by Surgical Intuitive USA

  • C/C++, Python, Machine Learning

    • This project was granted by Surgical Intuitive USA and its aims to develop new tactile device that provide haptic sensation to the user. It used a novel ferro-fluid based mechanism to impart tactile sensation the user.The proposed device was able to exhibit high frequency vibrations cues and reasonable contact force. Device performance was tested via creating a simulated surface in OpenHaptics SDK and phantom Omni was used to manipulate the contact point thus providing feedback of geometrical cues of the surface being operated upon and sensed by the user’s fingertip using device.

    Windows desktop application development in C++ using Microsoft Foundation Classes
  • C++ MFC, Direct Show Filters

    • Windows Desktop Application development in C++ using Microsoft Foundation Classes (MFC) and window media SDk. Development and customization of playback software using MFC.Development of SDK in C++ for Video/Audio capture cards i.e. DSPC-8601 and Aver media PCI Express C351W.MFC desktop application integration with video recorder system with PCM-3365 PC Intel Atom E3845 1.33 GHz dual core processor.
